docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Rep. Cory Gardner formally kicked off his Senate campaign on Saturday by tying his challenge to Democratic Sen. Mark Udall to the GOP's efforts to reverse its decade-long slide in this key political bellwether state.

headline.main: Rep. Cory Gardner Launches Senate Run
headline.print_headline: Rep. Cory Gardner Launches Senate Run

docs.snippet: Republican Rep. Cory Gardner formally kicked off his Senate campaign on Saturday by tying his challenge to Democratic Sen. Mark Udall to the GOP's efforts to reverse its decade-long slide in this key political bellwether state.

docs.lead_paragraph: For those trying to enroll through online health exchanges, help has long been advertised as just a phone call away.

headline.main: Long Waits Frustrate Callers to Health Exchanges
headline.print_headline: Long Waits Frustrate Callers to Health Exchanges

docs.snippet: For those trying to enroll through online health exchanges, help has long been advertised as just a phone call away.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama is challenging Congress to help him create jobs and rebuild the nation's infrastructure.

headline.main: Obama Challenges Congress to Help Create Jobs
headline.print_headline: Obama Challenges Congress to Help Create Jobs

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama is challenging Congress to help him create jobs and rebuild the nation's infrastructure.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton's advisers sought to "humanize" what they saw as her stern, defensive public image during her husband's White House days and as she embarked on her groundbreaking Senate campaign in New York.

headline.main: Clinton Advisers Sought to Soften Her Image
headline.print_headline: Clinton Advisers Sought to Soften Her Image

docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton's advisers sought to "humanize" what they saw as her stern, defensive public image during her husband's White House days and as she embarked on her groundbreaking Senate campaign in New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal officials said they agreed to provide subsidies retroactively for insurance purchased in the private market because technical problems had prevented consumers from using the online exchanges.

headline.main: New Health Fix Offers Subsidies for Insurance Policies Bought Outside Exchanges
headline.print_headline: New Health Fix Offers Subsidies for Insurance Policies Bought Outside Exchanges

docs.abstract: Obama administration says it will allow some people to receive federal subsidies for health insurance purchased in the private market outside of health insurance exchanges; shift is latest in series of policy changes, extensions and clarifications by federal officials trying to help beneficiaries and minimize political damage to Democrats in this election year.
docs.snippet: Federal officials said they agreed to provide subsidies retroactively for insurance purchased in the private market because technical problems had prevented consumers from using the online exchanges.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Newly released papers underscored what a pivotal force Hillary Rodham Clinton was in her husband’s White House, intimately involved in the policy and politics that shaped Washington in the 1990s.

headline.main: Thousands of Bill Clinton White House Papers Released
headline.print_headline: Clinton Memos Offer Window Into Past and Fodder for 2016

docs.abstract: National Archives release of previously withheld memos, transcripts and other papers from Clinton White House underscores what a pivotal force Hillary Clinton was, intimately involved in the politics that shaped Washington in the 1990s; memos offer rare and more detailed look at the machinations from an era that are now of acute interest, as Clinton possibly gears up for presidential run in 2016.
docs.snippet: Newly released papers underscored what a pivotal force Hillary Rodham Clinton was in her husband’s White House, intimately involved in the policy and politics that shaped Washington in the 1990s.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Amy Chozick from New York. Jackie Calmes and Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington, and Sarah Cohen from New York. Kitty Bennett contributed research.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER and AMY CHOZICK
